channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Has a shelter pet changed your life? We want to hear about it
item.description: National Adopt a Shelter Pet Day is on April 30. To celebrate, NPR wants to know how your pet has changed your life. We would also love to see photos ...

item.title: Higher prices are likely for these 10 grocery items when tariffs hit
item.description: A trip to the grocery or liquor store is about to become even more expensive, economists say. From seafood to olive oil, these items will likely cost ...

item.title: Popular brands of liquid eggs are recalled over bleach contamination concerns
item.description: Over 200,000 pounds of Egg Beaters and Bob Evans products were recalled over potential cleaning solution contamination. The USDA says that health risk...

item.title: Stocks sink in another brutal day, as Trump's tariffs send global shockwaves
item.description: Investors, businesses and consumers all seem terrified of how President Trump's tariffs could upend the global economy.

item.title: National Endowment for the Humanities staff put on immediate leave
item.description: A majority of NEH employees received an email placing them on immediate leave. The news comes just days after many humanities councils across the coun...

item.title: Map shows measles cases across U.S.
item.description: CBS News is tracking a outbreak of measles in West Texas that has led to the death of a child, and a growing number of cases around the country.

item.title: 'Don't speak, don't film': Journalist arrests fuel fears for democracy after Turkey protests
item.description: Yasin Akrul says his arrest was a warning to stop others taking pictures of the demonstrations in Turkey.

item.title: Trump to delay enforcement of TikTok ban with another executive order
item.description: A deal to sell the widely popular platform remains a work in progress.

item.title: Dow Jones drops 1,800 points as stock market rout deepens
item.description: Stocks continued to tumble Friday in the U.S. after financial markets suffered their biggest one-day drop since 2020.

item.title: Children among 14 dead in Russian attack on Ukrainian city, officials say
item.description: The head of the local defence council says a ballistic missile landed in the centre of a residential area.

item.title: How the scale of Myanmar's loss is clearer one week after the quake
item.description: More than 3,000 people have been confirmed dead after last week's earthquake and the toll is expected to rise.

item.title: 3/31: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: Widespread storms leave hundreds of thousands without electricity. Also, expert unpacks the $80 million Wisconsin Supreme Court race.

item.title: Nearly half of National Weather Services offices have 20% vacancy rates, and experts say itâ€™s a risk
item.description: Data obtained by The Associated Press shows that close to half of the local National Weather Service forecast offices have 20% vacancy rates as severe...

item.title: Ronin the rat sets new landmine-sniffing record
item.description: Ronin, a giant African pouched rat, is the first rodent to uncover more than 100 mines in Cambodia.

item.title: South and Midwest face potentially catastrophic rains and floods while reeling from tornadoes
Rat breaks world record for sniffing out wartime landmines
item.description: A mine-sniffing African giant pouched rat named Ronin has been acknowledged by the Guinness World Records.

item.title: Trump administration issues demands on Harvard as conditions for billions in federal money
Videos show aftermath of Israeli strike on school-turned-shelter in Gaza
item.description: BBC Verify explains what we know about the incident after reviewing videos that were posted online.
